title: Enlightenment: Reason and Natural Rights

vocab.definition: 18th century intellectual movement emphasizing reason and science
Rights believed to be inherent to all humans by nature
Agreement between people and government defining rights and duties
Division of government into legislative, executive, and judicial branches
French Enlightenment thinker who applied reason to social problems

teachingNotes: Connect Enlightenment ideas to American and French revolutions. Analyze how these concepts influenced modern democratic government.

sample.question: What 18th century movement emphasized reason and science?

truefalse.question: Natural rights are believed to be inherent to all humans. (True or False)
The Enlightenment emphasized reason and science. (True or False)
The social contract ignores government duties. (True or False)
Separation of powers divides government into branches. (True or False)
Philosophes applied reason to social problems. (True or False)
The Enlightenment occurred in the 18th century. (True or False)
Natural rights are given by government. (True or False)
The social contract defines rights and duties. (True or False)
Separation of powers concentrates authority. (True or False)
Enlightenment ideas influenced revolutions. (True or False)

fillintheblank.question: _____ rights are inherent to all humans.
The _____ _____ is an agreement between people and government.
_____ of powers divides government into branches.
A _____ was a French Enlightenment thinker.
The Enlightenment occurred in the _____ century.
Natural rights are believed _____ to humans.
The social contract defines rights and _____.

shortanswer.question: What was the Enlightenment?
expectedAny: 18th century intellectual movement emphasizing reason and science
Age of Reason focusing on rational thought

shortanswer.question: What are natural rights?
expectedAny: Rights believed to be inherent to all humans by nature

shortanswer.question: What is the social contract?
expectedAny: Agreement between people and government defining rights and duties

shortanswer.question: What is separation of powers?
expectedAny: Division of government into legislative executive and judicial branches

shortanswer.question: Who were philosophes?
expectedAny: French Enlightenment thinkers who applied reason to social problems

shortanswer.question: What did Enlightenment thinkers value?
expectedAny: Reason science and evidence over tradition and authority

shortanswer.question: Why are natural rights important?
expectedAny: They are inherent and universal protecting all individuals
Fundamental to human dignity and freedom

shortanswer.question: How does social contract work?
expectedAny: People consent to government in exchange for protection of rights
Citizens and government have mutual obligations

shortanswer.question: Why separate powers?
expectedAny: To prevent tyranny by checking and balancing power

shortanswer.question: What impact did Enlightenment have?
expectedAny: Influenced American and French revolutions and democratic government
Inspired movements for rights and freedom
